intro: Mikania turbaricola, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and is characterized by its rapid growth and sprawling habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are trailing and can root at the nodes. Mikania turbaricola is often found in disturbed areas, such as along roadsides and in moist, sunny habitats.
